Vegetable Biryani.description: Vegetable version of the biryani rice

Vegetable Jalfrezi.ingredients: besan, sugar, vegetables, spices, rai, cream, milk, ginger
Vegetable Jalfrezi.description: Vegetable Jalfrezi is a semi-dry Bangladeshi Indian curry made with a tangy, colourful blend of stir-fried mixed vegetables cooked in a thick spicy tomato base flavoured with various spices. Mixed veg jalfrezi being a blend of many vegetables and spices is not only a flavorful and colourful food but is also healthy and nutritious.

Vegetable Tarkari.description: Vegetable tarkaris, are a spicy vegetable curry, which is very popular in Bangladesh. These curries made from vegetables are quite popular in large parts of the Indian subcontinent. They are basically made by mixing vegetables with various kinds of  spices and by boiling them. They are served with rice.

Veggie Burger.ingredients: vegetables, textured vegetable protein, legumes, nuts, mushrooms, grains
Veggie Burger.description:
Veggie Burger is a hamburger-style, or chicken-style, patty that does not contain meat, but may contain animal products such as egg or milk.[1] The patty of a veggie burger may be made from vegetables (like potato or corn), textured vegetable protein (like soy), legumes (beans), tofu, nuts, mushrooms, or grains or seeds, like wheat and flax.

https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Veggie_burger

Veg Hakka Noodles.ingredients: hakka noodles, vegetables, soy sauce, chilli vinegar, oil, red chilli sauce
Veg Hakka Noodles.description: Veg Hakka noodles is an Indo-Chinese preparation that is made by tossing boiled noodles and stir-fried vegetables in Chinese sauces. The vegetables give it an enjoyable crunchy texture and the soy and chilli sauces give it a distinctive flavour.

Veg Hara Bhara Kabab.description: Hara Bhara Kabab is a tempting and delicious  appetizer from Indian Cuisine!

Veg Kadai.ingredients: potatoes, cauliflower, carrots, beas, coriander, pumpkin, tomatoes, spices, oil
Veg Kadai.description: Veg Kadai or Kadai vegetable sabzi is a delicious Indian vegetarian dish comprising of a mixture of veggies in cooked in a spicy gravy flavoured with a special Kadai masala. Veg Kadai or Kadai vegetable is traditionally prepared in a ‘Kadai’, a type of thick, circular, and deep cooking utensil formed from mild steel or wrought iron.

Veg Kofta Curry.ingredients: spices, vegetables, cheese, besan, herbs.oil, salt
Veg Kofta Curry.description: Veg Kofta Curry is an exotic Indian gravy dish made from mix vegetable dumplings dunked in an onion-tomato based gravy. Koftas are small round or oval-shaped dumplings made from minced vegetables, paneer etc. along with mild spices that are deep-fried. These Kofta balls have a crispy outer layer and are soft from the inside.

Veg Manchurian.ingredients: flour, corn flour, vegetables, spices, salt, ginger-garlic paste.
Veg Manchurian.description: Veg Manchurian is a widely popular Indo-Chinese dish across India. This dish is made of deep-fried mixed vegetable dumplings tossed in Chinese sauces. Dry Vegetable Manchurian is a very popular recipe across India. It can be found in many Indian restaurants and is commonly served in parties. It is also very popular street food and spicier version of the dish are available on many roadside stalls.

Veg Spring Rolls.ingredients: flour, spring roll wrapper, vegetables, soy sauce, salt
Veg Spring Rolls.description: Veg Spring Rolls are crispy deep-fried snacks filled with a delicious stuffing of lightly spiced and crunchy vegetables. Spring Rolls are a popular Asian snack which is often served before the meals as an appetizer. A mixture of vegetables, salt and spices is rolled into spring roll wrappers and is then deep-fried or baked. This results in a crunchy and delicious snack.

Vellayappam.description: A light, lacy pancake made with rice and coconut. It’s traditionally eaten for breakfast as an accompaniment to a curry.

Vep\u0159o Knedlo Zelo.ingredients: roasting pork, garlic, ground caraway, lard, plain flour, rohliks, fresh yeast, sugar, coarse flour, salt, milk, milk, eggs, sauerkraut, onions, belly bacon, polohruba
Vep\u0159o Knedlo Zelo.description: Vepro Knedlo Zelo is a national dish of Czech. One of the most highly coveted dishes in the Czech Republic. Vepro-knedlo-zelo is shorthand for roast pork.

Verivorst.ingredients: potatoes, pork, barley, onions, allspice, marjoram
Verivorst.description: Verivorst is traditional Estonian blood sausage and the country's national dish. It is a typical winter meal, usually served during the Christmas festivities, when piles of verivorst sausages are roasted together with potatoes and pork. The sausage consists of barley, onions, allspice, marjoram, and blood. All of the ingredients are stuffed into a pig's intestine, and the sausage is typically accompanied by butter, sour cream, and sauerkraut on the side.

Vetkoek.ingredients: dough, sugar, syrup, honey, jam, beef
Vetkoek.description: Vetkoek is a traditional South African fried dough bread. It is either served filled with cooked mince (ground beef) or with syrup, honey, or jam.

Vettu Cake.description: These yummy looking cakes are made of maida, sugar, cardamom powder and eggs.A cake available in Kerala tea shops to relish with chai.

Viano\u010dn\u00e1 Kapustnica.description: Vianočná Kapustnica is a special version of the traditional Slovak Cabbage Soup (Kapustnica) with the difference that the soup doesn't have meat in it and it is thickened with white plain halušky, cream, and potatoes.

Vichyssoise.ingredients: leeks, onions, potatoes, cream, chicken stock
Vichyssoise.description:
A thick soup made of boiled and pureed leeks, onions, potatoes, cream, and chicken stock. It is traditionally served cold but it can be eaten hot. 



https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Vichyssoise

Viciebsk Cutlets.ingredients: pork, white bread, pepper, salt, onions
Viciebsk Cutlets.description: Its a most popular traditional snacks of Belarusian made with egg, butter.

Victoria Bitter B (Vb).description: Victoria Bitter (VB) is one of the most popular Australian beers. It is of the "American Adjunct Lager" style with a 4.9% alcohol by volume (ABV). Brewed by Carlton & United Breweries, Ltd. Australia

Vienna Bread.description: Vienna bread is a type of bread that is produced from a process developed in Vienna, Austria, in the 19th century. The Vienna process used high milling of Hungarian grain and cereal press-yeast for leavening.

Viennese Apfelstrudel.ingredients: whipped cream, cinnamon, sugar, cinnamon, bread crumbs, butter, apple
Viennese Apfelstrudel.description: Viennese Apfelstrudel is the national dish of Austria and also popular pastry. It is made with whipped cream, cinnamon, sugar, cinnamon, bread crumbs, butter, apple. This dish is very tasty and easy to prepare.

Viennoiserie.description: It is baked goods made from a yeast-leavened dough in a manner similar to bread, or from puff pastry, but with added ingredients (particularly eggs, butter, milk, cream, and sugar) giving them a richer, sweeter character, approaching that of pastry. The dough is often laminated. Viennoiseries are typically eaten at breakfast or as snacks.

Vietnamese Caramel Chicken.ingredients: 1 lb chicken thighs with skin, deboned, 2 tablespoons oil, 3 cloves garlic, minced, 1/2 jalapeno, sliced  marinade:  1 tablespoon sugar, 1 tablespoon fish sauce black pepper, caramel sauce:  1 tablespoon fish sauce, 3 tablespoons water 1/2 tablespoon sugar, 3 teaspoons rice vinegar or apple cider vi
Vietnamese Caramel Chicken.description: This traditional Vietnamese-style caramel chicken recipe from Cook's Illustrated promises a dish that perfectly balances a bittersweet caramel with salty and spicy flavors.

Vieux Carre Cocktail.ingredients: rye whiskey, cognac, sweet vermouth, benedictine, bitters
Vieux Carre Cocktail.description: Vieux Carre is divinely complex. Its Made with rye whiskey, Cognac, sweet vermouth, Benedictine, and two styles of bitters.

Vieux Carr\u00e9 Cocktail.description: The Vieux Carré is an IBA official cocktail made with rye whiskey, cognac, sweet vermouth liqueur, Bénédictine, and Peychaud's bitters,

Vigan empanada.description:
Vigan empanadas are deep-fried, resulting in a crispy shell-like dough that’s very different from the soft, semi-sweet dough used in other types of Filipino empanadas.

Fillings vary but Vigan empanadas typically contain grated green papaya, mung bean sprouts, shredded carrots, skinless Vigan longganisa (Filipino sausage), and a whole egg.

Vigoron.ingredients: cabbage, tomatoes, onions, chili pepper, vinegar, salt
Vigoron.description: Vigoron is a traditional Nicaraguan dish. It consists of a cabbage salad known as curtido (chopped cabbage, tomatoes, onions, and chilli pepper marinated in vinegar and salt), boiled yuca, and chicharrones (fried pork belly or fried pork rinds), all wrapped in a banana leaf.

Viili.description: Its a yogurt-like fermented milk product. It is a traditional Finnish heirloom yogurt with a a slimy and viscous consistency.

Vinagrete.ingredients: onions, tomatoes, parsley, white wine vinegar, red bell pepper, olive oil, salt
Vinagrete.description: This traditional is a typical Brazilian condiment made of tomato, chopped onion, olive oil, vinegar, salt, and bell pepper. It usually accompanies salads, grilled meat, and roasted chicken.It's similar to pebre and pico de gallo, spicy Chilean and Mexican condiments with similar ingredients.

Vinarterta.description: Vinarterta is a multi-layered cake made from alternating layers of white vanilla- or cardamom-flavored shortbread and plum jam, the jam usually including spices such as cinnamon, cloves, and cardamom.

Vinegret.description: It includes diced cooked vegetables (beetroots, potatoes, carrots), chopped onions, as well as sauerkraut аnd/or brined pickles. Other ingredients, such as green peas or beans, are sometimes also added. The naming comes from vinaigrette,  which is used as a dressing. https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Vinegret

Vinegrette.ingredients: potatoes, carrots, beet, onions, peas, oil
Vinegrette.description: Vinegrette is a traditional Russian salad made of boiled beets, potatoes, carrots, pickles, onions and sauerkraut. It is easy to cook and remains very popular especially in winter time.

Vi\u0219inat\u0103.description: Visinata is a Romanian alcoholic beverage produced from sour cherries (vișine in Romanian), sugar and alcohol. It is very flavorful and sweet, and most often home-made.

Vispipuuro.description: Its a  cold, whipped porridge made with lingonberries and wheat semolina. Best served with milk and sugar.

Vitamalz.description: Vitamalz is a German malt beer without alcohol. Wikipedia

Vitello Tonnato.ingredients: veal, chicken stock, white wine, mayonnaise, carrots, celery, rosemary, tuna, anchovy fillets, lemon juice
Vitello Tonnato.description:
Vitello tonnato is a Piedmontese dish of cold, sliced veal covered with a creamy, mayonnaise-like sauce that has been flavored with tuna. It is served chilled or at room temperature, generally in the summertime, as the main course of an Italian meal or as "an exceedingly elegant antipasto for an elaborate dinner". It is also very popular in Argentina, where it is known as vitel toné, and considered a traditional Christmas dish.


https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Vitello_tonnato

Vitumbua.ingredients: rice flour, yeast, coconut milk, coconut sugar, coconut, brown sugar, vanilla, spice cardamom
Vitumbua.description: Vitumbua is a deep-fried dish commonly served during breakfast, especially with tea. It is a Tanzanian delicacy. It is made with rice flour, yeast, coconut milk, coconut sugar, coconut, brown sugar, vanilla, spice cardamom. It is sweet-tasting and melts in your mouth.

Vitus Beer.description:
Beer of the Weizenbock style with 7.70% alcohol by volume (ABV)
Brewed by Bayerische Staatsbrauerei Weihenstephan. Germany

Vizzy Hard Seltzer.description:
Vizzy Hard Seltzer  is a carbonated alcoholic beverage with 5% alcohol by volume (ABV)

One 12 OZ can contains 100 Calories, 1g of Sugar and 2g of Carbs.
1 ounce contains: 8.33g of Calories, 0.08g of Sugar and 0.17g of Carbs.

Vla.description: Vla is made with eggs, sugar, and fresh milk, although some industrial producers use cornstarch rather than eggs today. Vla is available in many different flavors of which vanilla is most popular. Other flavors include chocolate, caramel, banana, orange, and apple.

Vlokken.description: Vlokken is a commonly used sandwich topping in the Netherlands. A vlok is made of chocolate and is curved, its size is about 0.5 cm x 2 cm x 0.1 cm. It is sold in different chocolate flavors, including dark, milk, white and a mix of those three.

Vodka.description: Distilled beverage composed primarily of water and ethanol, sometimes with traces of impurities and flavorings. Traditionally, vodka is made by the distillation of cereal grains or potatoes that have been fermented, though some modern brands use other substances, such as fruits or sugar.

Volauvent.description: It is typically made by cutting two circles in rolled out puff pastry, cutting a hole in one of them, then stacking the ring-shaped piece on top of the disc-shaped piece.

Volcano Roll.description: Shrimp tempura, avocado and scallion covered with spicy seafood sauce and topped with bonito

Voon.ingredients: thick coconut milk, eggs, thin coconut milk, mun, white sugar,
Voon.description: This is a classic Lao dessert. It's a jelly made with coconut milk.

Vori Vori.description: Vori Vori is a thick, yellow soup with little balls made of cornmeal, corn flour, and cheese.

Vypr\u00e1\u017ean\u00fd Reze\u0148.description: Vyprážaný rezeň is a very common dish in Slovakia made of fried breaded pork cutlets

Waakye.description: Waakye is a Ghanaian dish of cooked rice and beans. This dish is strikingly similar to the West Indian version, 'rice and peas'. The rice is cooked with an indigenous leaf and black-eyed peas or kidney beans. It is commonly prepared in the home but is also sold by roadside vendors. Waakye is a very popular dish in Ghana

Waffle.description:
A waffle is a leavened batter or dough cooked between two plates, patterned to give a characteristic size, shape and surface impression. There are many variations based on the type of waffle iron and recipe used, with over a dozen regional varieties in Belgium alone

Wiki

Waffle Sandwich.description: A sandwich that uses waffles instead of bread

Wagashi.description: Wagashi is a traditional Japanese confection that is often served with tea. Sweet azuki bean paste (anko) is a central ingredient in a large number of Japanese sweets. Boiled azuki beans are sweetened with sugar and mashed to create either smooth anko (koshian) or chunky anko (tsubuan).

Wai Khua.ingredients: squid, coconut milk, chalets, lemon grass
Wai Khua.description:
Baby squid cooked in a thick coconut milk gravy.
Local dish from Koh Samui

Waldorf Salad.description:
The salad was first created between 1893 and 1896 at the Waldorf Hotel in New York City (the precursor of the Waldorf-Astoria Hotel, which came into being with the merger of the Waldorf with the adjacent Astoria Hotel, opened in 1897). 


https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Waldorf_salad

Wali Na Maharage.ingredients: rice, beans, herbs, spices, coconut milk
Wali Na Maharage.description: Wali na maharage is a Tanzanian dish made with red beans and rice. The rice is usually cooked with coconut milk or oil, while the beans are cooked until mushy. The dish is seasoned with a variety of spices such as pepper, cardamom, cinnamon, cloves, and cumin. It can be served as an accompaniment to vegetables, fish, or meat.

Wali Wa Nazi.description: Wali Wa Nazi is a popular Kenyan food mostly along the Indian Ocean coast. White rice is cooked with grated coconut meat to create a fragrant twist on plain boiled rice. Wali wa nazi is best enjoyed with a serving of fish or chicken curry, some vegetables, or even bean stew.

Walnut And Coffee Cake.ingredients: sponge cake, coffee, walnut pieces, sugar
Walnut And Coffee Cake.description: Walnut And Coffee Cake is a cake made with a normal sponge cake recipe with the addition of coffee, usually either instant coffee or Camp Coffee and walnut pieces.The cake is often filled with flavored butter icing and topped with more butter icing and half-walnuts.

Walnut Pie.description: Walnut Pie is a pie prepared with walnuts as a primary ingredient. Whole or chopped walnuts may be used, or both, and toasted walnuts may be used. It may be prepared as a cream pie and may include maple syrup, molasses, and cinnamon as ingredients. It may be prepared with a sweet filling base prepared with corn syrup, sugar, and eggs, similar to pecan pie filling. Chocolate and honey may also be used. Walnut pie may be prepared using fruits such as raisins, figs, plums, and cranberries, among others.

Walnut Stuffed Prunes.description: Walnut stuffed prunes is a simple and delectable Ukrainian dessert. Prunes are stuffed with walnuts and drenched in condensed milk.

Wantan Frito.description: Deep fried wontons with a meat filling, (usually pork), eaten with duck sauce.

Wappa Meshi.description:
Wappameshi is Japanese dish cooked in special round containers made of thin wooden sheets. It is rice topped with other ingredients and is a speciality of the Niigata prefecture.


wappa - special round containers
Mitsuba - Cryptotaenia

https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Wappameshi

Warabimochi.description: Warabimochi is a jelly-like confection made from bracken starch and covered or dipped in kinako (sweet toasted soybean flour).

Warak Arish.description: Stuffed grape leaves known as “Warak Enab” in Arabic, is a Lebanese dish of spiced rice and beef rolled in grape leaves and simmered in a Lemony broth.

Warbat.ingredients: phyllo dough, butter, milk, cream, lemon, corn starch, sugar
Warbat.description: Warbat also is known as Shaabiyat is an Arabic sweet pastry (originally from Jordan) similar to baklava, consisting of layers thin phyllo dough filled with custard though it is sometimes also filled with pistachios, walnuts, almonds, or sweet cheese. The dessert is topped with a sweet syrup made from sugar, water, and a hint of lemon brought to a boil and then left to cool and thicken.

Warm Mango And Prawn Salad.ingredients: mango, prawn, snow peas, vietnamese mint, oil
Warm Mango And Prawn Salad.description:
This dish relies on the mango being semi-ripe so as to add a little sweetness, just enough softness from its texture and a hint of sourness. The French mustard in the dressing is a nod to the history of French colonization of Vietnam. Serve as part of a shared meal.

Source url: http://www.sbs.com.au/food/recipes/warm-mango-and-prawn-salad

Warqa.description:
Warqa is a Moroccan pastry, made in a thin sheet format, such as phyllo pastry is. Compared to phyllo, Warqa is slightly thicker and a bit more glutinous, and is more moisture resistant than phyllo. It is made from flour with oil, salt and water added to it.
https://www.cooksinfo.com/warqa

Wasakaka.ingredients: avocados, citrus juice, parsley, garlic, chilli peppers
Wasakaka.description: Wasakaka is a savoury sauce found in Venezuelan cuisine often on chicken. The sauce is made from avocados, citrus juice or vinegar, parsley, garlic, and chilli peppers. Argentina chimichurri, Cuban mojo, and the Chilean pebre share the same ingredients and predate the guasacaca sauce.

Wasp Rice Crackers.ingredients: water, eggs, rice flour, wasp. sugar, salt, oil, sesame seeds, soy sauce
Wasp Rice Crackers.description: Wasp rice crackers which are also called Jibachi Senbei are Japanese crackers. They are prepared with water, eggs, rice flour, wasp. sugar, salt, oil, sesame seeds, soy sauce. They are very famous and sold in many stores and street vendors.

Wat.description: Wat is an Ethiopian and Eritrean stew prepared with meat, vegetables, niter kibbeh, spices. Meat can be chicken, beef, or lamb. Wat is traditionally eaten with injera.

Watalappan.ingredients: eggs, sugar, coconut milk, cinnamon, cardamom, nutmeg
Watalappan.description: It is very popular with Sri Lankan Muslims, is a must for their religious festivals. It’s a rich steamed egg custard made with Kitul jaggery, coconut milk and spices like cinnamon, cardamom and nutmeg. Air bubbles keep the thick dessert from getting too heavy.

Watergate Salad.ingredients: pistachio pudding, canned pineapple, cool whip, marshmallows
Watergate Salad.description: Watergate Salad is a side dish salad or dessert salad made from pistachio pudding, canned pineapple, whipped topping, and marshmallows. It is very quick to prepare, the ingredients are combined and it can be chilled if desired

Waterzooi.ingredients: fish or chicken, vegetable broth, egg yolks, cream
Waterzooi.description: Waterzooi is a stew dish from Belgium and originating in Flanders . The second part of the name derives from the Middle Dutch terms "sode", "zo(o)de" and "soot", words referring to the act of boiling or the ingredients being boiled.

Weihnachtsgans.description: Weihnachtsgans or Roasted Goose is a traditional German dish served for festive occasions, especially for Christmas Eve.

Weisswurst.description: The word Weißwurst or Weisswurst can be translated to white sausage and it is indeed very white, rather than pink, red, or tan like other sausages. It is also never fried and never grilled, instead it is heated in water and needs to be enjoyed very fresh.

Welf Pudding.ingredients: milk, vanilla, egg whites, sugar, white wine lemon juice
Welf Pudding.description: Welf Pudding is a two-layered pudding from Germany. The white bottom layer is made from a cooked milk and vanilla sauce on a base of very stiffly whipped egg white. After being chilled it is then covered with a yellow layer of wine sauce made of beaten egg yolk, white wine, and a little lemon juice.

Welsh Cake.description:
Cakes made from flour, butter/lard, currants, eggs, milk, and spices such as cinnamon and nutmeg. They are roughly circular, a few inches (7–8 cm) in diameter and about half an inch (1–1.5 cm) thick.

Welsh cakes are served hot or cold dusted with caster sugar. Unlike scones, they are not usually eaten with an accompaniment, though they are sometimes sold ready split and spread with jam, and they are sometimes buttered.

Welsh Cheese.ingredients: strong cheese, butter, worcestershire sauce, dry mustard, flour, pepper, beer, bread
Welsh Cheese.description: Welsh Cheese is perhaps the most famous Welsh dish of them all and one which, along with Irish Stew and Scottish Haggis, travelled the world over.

Welsh Rabbit.description: Welsh rabbit is a dish simply made of toasted bread slices and melted cheese.

Welsh Rarebit.description:
Dish made with a savory sauce of melted cheese and various other ingredients and served hot, after being poured over slices (or other pieces) of toasted bread, or the hot cheese sauce may be served in a chafing dish like a fondue, accompanied by sliced, toasted bread.The names of the dish originate from 18th-century Britain.




https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Welsh_rarebit

Western Omelette.ingredients: eggs, bell pepper, ham, onions, cheese
Western Omelette.description: A Western Omelette is made with chopped ham, bell peppers and onions

What are the Health Benefits of Indore\u.description:
Are you an Indori Papad lover but afraid that it may not be good for your health? Don't worry! Indore's Papad actually offers several health benefits that you may not be aware of. Read this blog to find out!Indori papads are a favourite snack among all people, known for their unique taste and crispiness. However, as people love to eat them and may forget about their health concerns, it is important to highlight the various health effects of Indori papad. People have different opinions about papad and its impact on health, but it is worth noting that when consumed in moderation, Indori papad can actually be beneficial for your overall well-being. 
In this blog, we will explore the nutritional value of the Indori papad and how you can enjoy papad online. So, let's dive in and discover the surprising health benefits of this beloved snack!

Wheat Beer.description:
American wheat beer is typically lighter in appearance and is know as a refreshing summer style beer. In America wheat beer brews with at least 30 percent malted wheat.

IBU (Bitterness) Between 10 - 35 out of 100 (most bitter)
ABV (Alcohol By Volume) 3.5% - 5.6%
SRM (Color) 2 - 10 out of 40 (most dark)

Wheat Parotta.ingredients: whole wheat flour, salt, cooking oil, water
Wheat Parotta.description: Wheat parotta is a popular kerala style crisp flaky multi layered flatbread made with whole wheat flour.

Whipped Cream.description: Whipped cream is cream that is whipped by a whisk or mixer until it is light and fluffy. Whipped cream is often sweetened and sometimes flavored with vanilla. Whipped cream is often called Chantilly cream or crème Chantilly

Whiskey Barrel-aged Double Mexican Radio.description: Whiskey Barrel-Aged Double Mexican Radio is an "Stout - American Imperial" style American beer with 11% Alcohol by volume (ABV). Brewed by Bluejacket / Arsenal Restaurant District of Columbia, United States

Whiskey Cobbler.description: Whiskey Cobbler is a recipe straight out of the late 1800s, a mix of seasonal fruit dresses up a sweetened whiskey. Add club soda if you like or enjoy it as is, it's fabulous either way.

Whiskey Sour Cocktail.ingredients: whiskey, lemon juice, sugar, egg white
Whiskey Sour Cocktail.description: whiskey sour is a mixed drink containing whiskey (often bourbon), lemon juice, sugar, and optionally, a dash of egg white. With the egg white, it is sometimes called a Boston Sour. With a few bar spoons of full-bodied red wine floated on top, it is often referred to as a New York Sour. It is shaken and served either straight up or over ice.

Whisky.description: Whisky is a type of distilled alcoholic beverage made from fermented grain mash. Various grains (which may be melted) are used for different varieties, including barley, corn (maize), rye, and wheat. Whiskey is typically aged in wooden casks, generally made of charred white oak.

White Bread.description: It is typically referred to bread made from wheat flour from which the bran and the germ layers have been removed from the whole wheatberry as part of the flour grinding or milling process, producing a light-colored flour.

White Claw Hard Seltzer.description:
White Claw Hard Seltzer is a alcoholic beverage made of a blend of seltzer water, our gluten free alcohol base, and a hint of fruit flavor. With 100 calories, 2g carbs, and 5% alcohol /vol, White Claw comes in 5 fruit flavors.

1 ounce contains: 8.33 calories and 0.17 carbs.

White Cut Chicken.description: White-cut chicken, similar to Hainan chicken, is sought out for the collagen gel that forms under its skin. The collagen forms due to the cooking process, and has a slippery fatty texture akin to bone marrow. It is served lukewarm with a ginger-scallion dipping oil and plain rice. White-cut chicken is occasionally garnished with cilantro.

White Radish Soup.description: It is also known as mooli, it is originated in continental Asia and has a little spicy flavor in raw, yet sweet after cooked in recipes. This soup is one of the simple and light authentic Chinese foods.

White Russian Cocktail.description:
A White Russian is a cocktail made with vodka, coffee liqueur and cream served with ice in an Old Fashioned glass. Often milk or half and half will be used as an alternative to cream.

2/3 oz (2 parts) Coffee liqueur, 1 2/3 oz (5 parts) Vodka, 1 oz (3 parts) Fresh cream

White Sugar Sponge Cake.ingredients: rice flour, sugar, water, leavening agent
White Sugar Sponge Cake.description: White Sugar Sponge Cake is a type of Chinese pastry. It is one of the most common pastries in Hong Kong. It is made from rice flour, white sugar, water, and a leavening agent. The cake is white in color. The consistency is spongy and soft. The taste is sweet and sometimes has a slightly sour taste due to fermentation of the batter prior to cooking.

White Wine.description: White wine is a wine that is fermented without skin contact. The colour can be straw-yellow, yellow-green, or yellow-gold. It is produced by the alcoholic fermentation of the non-coloured pulp of grapes, which may have a skin of any colour. White wine has existed for at least 4000 years. Wikipedia

Whole Fish.description: It is Chinese cuisine.The Chinese word for "fish" sounds like the word for "abundance," one of the many reasons fish has become a go-to good luck food. Also, Rosemary Gong writes in Good Luck Life, her book on Chinese celebrations, that it's important for the fish be served with the head and tail intact to ensure a good year, from start to finish.

Whole Stuffed Camel.description:
Whole stuffed camel is a dish consisting of a medium-sized camel engastrated with a sheep or a lamb, in turn stuffed with other ingredients.

Although the recipe has been published in a number of cookbooks and recipe webpages, and claimed to be a traditional Arab wedding dish, the recipe is often treated with skepticism, and many think it might be an exaggeration of a real, less impressive, culinary experience. A posting on Snopes describes references in the recipe that might lead the reader to the conclusion that the recipe is, in fact, a joke, including instructions to "skin, trim, and clean the camel (once you get over the hump)...".

Reference to this recipe is made in the comedic novel I Served the King of England, first published in 1971 by Czech author Bohumil Hrabal as a traditional Ethiopian dish cooked for a visit to Prague by the Emperor Haile Selassie.

The Guinness Book of World Records lists the recipe as the "largest item on any menu in the world", "prepared occasionally for Bedouin wedding feasts.". According to the Milwaukee Journal, the steps are:

Cook eggs. Stuff eggs into fish. Cook the fish. Stuff the fish into cooked chickens. Stuff the cooked chickens into roasted sheep. Stuff the roasted sheep carcass into a whole camel . . . now cook to taste.

There is a reference in culinary expert Richard Sterling's book The Fearless Diner in which he claims to have met someone who cooked the entire recipe for "some sheik or other," in Saudi Arabia. Water Music by T. Coraghessan Boyle contains a recipe for camel stuffed with dates, plover eggs, carp, seasoned bustards, and sheep, baked for two days on hot coals in a trench.

https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Whole_stuffed_camel

Whole Wheat Bread.description: Whole Wheat Bread is a type of bread made using flour that is partly or entirely milled from whole or almost-whole wheat grains, see whole-wheat flour and whole grain. It is one kind of brown bread.

Whoopie Pie.description: A whoopie pie is like a sandwich, but made with two soft cookies with a fluffy white filling. Traditional ones are made with vegetable shortening, not butter. The original and most commonly made whoopie pie is chocolate. but cooks like to experiment, and today pumpkin whoopie pies are a favorite seasonal variation.

Why is Indore Famous for Its Sweets and.description:
Indore’s sweets and snacks are not just food items; they are an integral part of the city’s identity. They reflect the city’s spirit and its people’s love for food. Whether it’s a festive occasion or a casual get-together, Indore’s sweets and snacks are always the centre of attention. The city’s sweets and snacks have a unique taste and flavour that set them apart. Made with love and served with a smile, Indore foods are the city’s pride and joy.
In this blog, we will discuss the reasons behind the popularity of Indore’s sweets and snacks and how they have managed to capture the hearts of food lovers everywhere. So, let’s embark on this culinary journey and discover why Indore is famous for its sweets and snacks. From papad to namkeen, from traditional sweets to modern snacks, we will explore it all.

Why is Ratlami Sev a Must-Try from Indor.description: If you’re a foodie with a penchant for spicy, tangy, and utterly delicious snacks, then you’ve landed at the right place. Today, we’re going to take you on a culinary journey to Indore, the heart of India’s snack culture. Our star of the day? The irresistible Ratlami Sev. This isn’t just any snack; it’s a symphony of flavours that originated in the vibrant city of Ratlam in Indore. Available at your fingertips through online Namkeen stores, like Indore.Online, this Ratlami Sev from Indore is a must-try for every snack lover. So, whether in the bustling streets of Mumbai or in the comfort of your home, you can savour the authentic Ratlami Sev Namkeen with just a click.

Wibele.ingredients: flour, egg white, powdered sugar, vanilla sugar
Wibele.description: Wibele is a very small, sweet biscuits originating from the Franconian city of Langenburg in Germany, though nowadays they are considered a Swabian specialty. The dough is made from egg white, icing sugar, flour and vanilla sugar.

Wiener Saftgulasch.ingredients: beef shank, onions, spices, berries, dried marjoram, sugar, salt, tomato paste, garlic, lemon zest, flour.
Wiener Saftgulasch.description: Wiener Saftgulasch is an Austrian dish prepared with beef shank, onion, spices, berries, dried marjoram, sugar, salt, tomato paste, garlic, lemon zest, flour.

Wiener Schnitzel.description: It is made with the finest ingredients and served fresh, this simple dish of pounded veal cutlets breaded and lightly fried is Austria’s food ambassador, despite the dish’s Italian origins. Austrians typically eat Wiener schnitzel garnished with parsley and lemon slices, alongside potato salad.

Wild Basin Hard Seltzer.description:
Wild Basin Hard Seltzer is a carbonated alcoholic beverage with 5% alcohol by volume (ABV)

One 12 oz can contains 100 Calories, 0g of Sugar and 1g of Carbs.
1 ounce contains: 8.33g of Calories, 0g of Sugar and 0.08g of Carbs.

Willie's Superbrew Hard Seltzer.description:
Willie's Superbrew is a hard seltzer style alcoholic beverage containing 4.5% alcohol by volume and made using real fruit. It comes in many flavors including "Ginger & Lemon", "Mango & Passionfruit", "Pomegranate & Acai", "Pineapple & Lime" and "Blueberry & Lemon"

A 12 once can contain 110-120 calories and 5 grams of carbs
1 ounce contains 9.17- 10 calories and 0.4 carbs

Wine.description:
Wine is an alcoholic beverage made from grapes, generally Vitis vinifera, fermented without the addition of sugars, acids, enzymes, water, or other nutrients. Yeast consumes the sugar in the grapes and converts it to ethanol and carbon dioxide. The wine alcohol content or alcohol by volume is between 6% and 21%.
Wikipedia

Wing Bean And Pork Salad.description: Wing Bean And Pork Salad is a Thai salad. Its a mixture of wing bean and pork. It's not so much spicy, because there’s the creamy coconut milk to counteract the chilies, and the beans add the necessary and refreshing crunch. Wing Bean And Pork Salad is a very popular salad of Thai people.

Won Ton Mee.description: Won Ton Mee is a dish of noodles with pork, and broth and won tons, but just how it fits together varies; in a dry version the noodles are stir-fried with thick soy sauce and pork lard, with more pork on top, and a dish of broth and dumplings on the side; alternately, the noodles are served in the broth itself.

Wontons.ingredients: flour, eggs, water, salt, ground pork, spices, garlic, green onions
Wontons.description:
The most versatile shape of a wonton is simple a right triangle, similar to Italian tortellini. Wontons are commonly boiled and served in soup or sometimes deep-fried. The filling of wontons can be minced pork or diced shrimp. 



http://www.chinahighlights.com/travelguide/chinese-food/eight-chinese-dishes.htm

Wonton Soup.description: Wonton soup is a standard of Chinese cuisine and made from seasoned chicken broth with filled wontons. Wontons are an Asian equivalent of ravioli or tortellini when they are folded around a spiced meat mixture.

Wonton Strips.description: It is commonly served complimentary along with duck sauce and hot mustard at American Chinese restaurants, or with soup when ordering Chinese take-out. Wonton strips are traditionally made by frying wonton wrappers that have been cut into strips.

Wontons With Red Hot Sauce.description:
Sweet, savory, garlicky, and not as spicy as they look, Sichuan spicy wontons are a delicious combination of sweet soy sauce, raw garlic, roasted red chili, and a touch of vinegar to balance things out.

In the U.S., we’re in the midst of a huge explosion in the popularity of Sichuan food. Sichuan and Hunan-style restaurants are appearing in all of the major cities, and we like it! No matter where we travel in the U.S.–New Jersey, New York, Chicago, Houston, or Seattle–we always seem to find Sichuan cuisine, and these red chili oil wontons are one of the best Sichuan-style appetizers you can find.

Wood Apple Juice.description: Wood Apple Juice is a favourite with the locals is a wood apple smoothie, a blend with jaggery and water.

Wood Apple Milk.description: It a very popular dessert drink in Sri Lanka.

Wor Wonton Soup.ingredients: ground pork, green onions, soy sauce, sesame oil, ginger, egg white, chicken broth, vegetables, shrimps
Wor Wonton Soup.description: Wor Wonton Soup is a Chinese soup which means a wonton soup that has everything in it. It is prepared with ground pork, green onions, soy sauce, sesame oil, ginger, egg white, chicken broth, vegetables, shrimp.

Wotou.description: It is the shape of a hollow cone. It is a type of steamed bread made from cornmeal, butter, flour, eggs and sugar.

Wrap.description: A wrap is a food dish made with a soft flatbread rolled around a filling. The usual flatbreads are wheat tortillas, lavash, or pita; the filling usually consists of cold sliced meat, poultry, or fish (Wikipedia).

Xat\u00f3.ingredients: almonds, hazelnuts, breadcrumbs, vinegar, garlic, olive oil, salt
Xat\u00f3.description: Xato is a sauce made with almonds, hazelnuts, breadcrumbs, vinegar, garlic, olive oil, salt, and the nyora pepper. The sauce is often served with an endive salad prepared with anchovy, tuna and salted cod

Xihongshi Chao Jidan.description: Stir-fried tomato and scrambled eggs which slightly sweet and sour.

Xue Hua Bing.ingredients: shaved ice, sugar, condensed milk, juice
Xue Hua Bing.description: It is commonly referred to as Taiwanese snow ice.  Rather than flaky bits of ice, the base of the dessert is typically layered-sheets of frozen condensed milk.  The consistency is achieved through the milky base and a special machine that shaves the ice.

Ya\u011flama.ingredients: meat, onions, tomatoes, bell pepper, parsley, dough, yogurt sauce
Ya\u011flama.description:
Basically a meat sauce that is layered in-between layers of dough, Yaglama actually means “greasing,” which suggests that the meat sauce should be in very thin layers. Just a quick brushing of the meat sauce, in-between those fluffy layers of leavened bread dough, leaves a strong and rich flavor, while leaving an otherwise-heavy dish fairly light.


https://ibellhop.com/2014/04/04/more-of-the-best-traditional-food-dishes-from-around-the-world/

Yaguarlocro.ingredients: lamb, potatoes, tripe, tomatoes, onions, milk
Yaguarlocro.description: Yaguarlocro is a traditional soup from Ecuador made of the cleaned viscera of a goat, usually served with fried lamb blood, avocado, and pickled red onion rings.

Yaka Mein.ingredients: beef, spaghetti, eggs, onions, cajun spices, soy sauce, ketchup
Yaka Mein.description: Yaka Mein is a type of beef noodle soup.It is consists of stewed beef in beef-based broth served on top of noodles and garnished with half a hard-boiled egg and chopped green onions.

Yakgwa.ingredients: flour, oil, sugar, pine nuts, salt
Yakgwa.description: Yakgwa is a fried doughy dessert flavored with sesame oil and ginger and drenched in honey, are Korean traditional dessert.

Yakisoba.description: Yakisoba means (fried buckwheat), it is a Japanese noodle stir-fry dish. Although soba means buckwheat, yakisoba noodles are actually made from wheat flour, and are typically flavored with a condiment similar to Worcestershire sauce. The dish first appeared in food stalls in Japan during the early 20th century.

Yakisoba Pan.description: Yakisoba Pan is a Savory Spaghetti sandwich in Japan made of stir-fried noodles (Yakisoba) stuffed in hot dog bun. Yakisoba Pan is the ultimate sandwich for carb lovers.

Yakitori.description:
Yakitori is a Japanese type of skewered chicken. The preparation of Yakitori involves skewering the meat with kushi, a type of skewer typically made of steel, bamboo, or similar materials. Afterwards, they are grilled over a charcoal fire.


https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Yakitori

Yaki Udon.description:
Yaki udon are thick, smooth, white Japanese noodles eaten with a special sauce, meat, and vegetables. It is simple to make and a popular dish in Japan. Yaki udon is a stir fried udon noodle in a soy based sauce.

https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Yaki_udon

Yaksha Shakam.ingredients: beef, water, salt, oil, pepper, soya sauce
Yaksha Shakam.description: If there’s a meat that can be argued as better than dried beef, it’s dried yak meat. Yak is similar tasting to beef, but it has a little bit of a different fragrance, and it supposedly is quite nutritious.

Yaksik.ingredients: brown sugar, canned chestnuts, chestnuts, cinnamon powder, cranberries, grape seed oil, honey, jujubes, pine nuts, raisins, sesame oil, soy sauce, sugar, sweet rice, vegetable oil, water
Yaksik.description: Yaksik is a sweet Korean dish made by steaming glutinous rice, and mixing with chestnuts, jujubes, and pine nuts. It is seasoned with honey or brown sugar, sesame oil, soy sauce, and sometimes cinnamon. It is traditionally eaten on Jeongwol Daeboreum, a Korean holiday which falls on every 15 January in the lunar calendar, but also for weddings and hwangap festivities.It’s a sweet, delicious treat that’s packed full of flavor and healthy ingredients.

Yalanchi.ingredients: ripe tomatoes, vegetable oil, onions, raisins, pine nuts, cinnamon, rice, salt, pepper
Yalanchi.description: This dish is yalanchi, or vegetarian stuffed grape leaves. In Turkish, yalanchi means "fake." It refers to the fact that these stuffed grape leaves do not contain meat. They are, therefore, fake stuffed grape leaves. If they were filled with meat, they would be called "dolma" (which means "stuffed" in Turkish) and can also refer to meat-stuffed peppers, tomatoes, zucchini, eggplant, etc. The word "sarma" means "wrapped" and can be used to refer to both the meat and non-meat filled grape leaves, which are wrapped with grape leaves, hence the term.  Yalanchi are always served cold, while their meat-filled cousins are served hot. Those are the major differences between the two: meat vs. no meat, and hot vs. cold. http://www.mission-food.com/2010/12/yalanchi-vegetarian-stuffed-grape.html

Yalanji.ingredients: rice, oil, spices, garlic, mint, tomatoes, onions
Yalanji.description: Yalanji is a Syrian appetizer, made with grape leaves stuffed with rice and a variety of vegetables that is served as a cold appetizer. It is similar to dolma. It is prepared with rice, oil, spices, garlic, mint, tomato, onion. It is very healthy. The only difference between yalanji and dolma is that dolma is non-veg as it needs meat whereas yalanji is prepared with vegetable only.

Yam Naem Khao Tod.description: Thai snack dish that includes lightly curried croquettes of fried rice, made into balls, broken apart, and mixed lightly fermented pig skin and pork, seasoned, and mixed into a salad.

Yam Ruam Mit Talay.description: A popular Thai street food to eat is a mixed mung bean noodle salad. The clear noodles are often mixed with your choice of seafood and and then are nicely flavored with lime juice.

Yangnyeomtongdak.ingredients: apple vinegar, baking soda, black ground pepper, canola oil, chicken, eggs, flour, garlic, hot pepper paste, ketchup, potato starch powder, rice syrup, salt, sweet rice flour
Yangnyeomtongdak.description: Sweet, sour, & spicy Korean fried chicken.

Yaniqueque.description: Yaniqueque is a deep-fried treat is said to get its name from Johnnycakes, brought over by English-speaking migrants in the 19th century. However, yaniqueque are made with flour instead of cornmeal and are completely different from American johnnycakes.

Yanjing 10 Beer.description: Yanjing 10º is a Chinese beer in the "American Lager" style with 3.4% ABV brewed by Beijing Yanjing Beer Group Corporation China.

Yaprak Sarma.ingredients: green or red cabbage leaves, onions, rice, herbs, spices.
Yaprak Sarma.description: It is wrapped vine leaves with a filling of rice, onion and spices like mint, currant, pepper and cinnamon.

Yaqona.description: Yaqona is a ceremonial drink originating from Fiji. The preparation of the drink starts with a root of a local pepper plant known as kava, officially named Piper methysticum, which is ground or mashed into a thick paste that is then mixed with water and finally sieved and poured into large wooden bowls.

Yaroa.ingredients: mashed sweet plantains, beef, pork, chicken, cheese, fries, mayonnaise, ketchup, mustard
Yaroa.description: Yaroa is a traditional dish originating from Santiago in the Dominican Republic. This casserole is prepared in many versions throughout the country, but it's most often made with mashed sweet plantains, beef, pork, chicken, cheese, fries, and condiments such as mayonnaise, ketchup, and mustard.

Yarpag Dolmasi.ingredients: beef, onions, rice, cilantro, dill, mint leaves, salt, pepper, vine leaves, butter, water
Yarpag Dolmasi.description: One of traditional dish of Azerbaijani region. Yarpag Dolmasi are traditionally stuffed with ground lamb and/or beef, rice, onions, and herbs.

Yatsuhashi.description: Yatsuhashi is a Japanese confectionery sold mainly as a souvenir sweet (miyagegashi). It is one of the best known meibutsu (famous regional products) of Kyoto. It is made from glutinous rice flour (上新粉? jōshinko), sugar and cinnamon. Baked, it is similar to senbei. Raw, unbaked yatsuhashi (Nama yatsuhashi) has a soft, mochi-like texture and is often eaten wrapped around red bean paste (餡? an), and may come in a variety of different flavours.

Yellow Dal.description: This thick and hearty Indian yellow dal is made from yellow split peas and is bursting with flavor courtesy of a simple blend of Indian spices.

Yerba Mate.ingredients: loose-leaf yerba mate, water, milk, sweetener
Yerba Mate.description: Yerba Mate is an Argentina's traditional drinks.

Yi Mein.description: When Yi mein is consumed on birthdays, it is generally referred to as Longevity noodles or Sau mein (壽麵/寿面). The Chinese character for "long" (長壽麵/长寿面) is also added as a prefix to represent "long life". Usually it is consumed with longevity buns during birthday celebrations.

Yogurt.description: Yogurt is a food produced by bacterial fermentation of milk. The bacteria used to make yogurt are known as yogurt cultures. The fermentation of lactose by these bacteria produces lactic acid, which acts on milk protein to give yogurt its texture and characteristic tart flavor. Wikipedia

Yorkshire Pudding.description:
Yorkshire pudding is an English food made from batter consisting of eggs, flour, and milk or water. It is often served with beef and gravy and is part of the traditional British Sunday roast.



https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Yorkshire_pudding

Youtiao.description: Deep-fried dough often served during breakfast with hot soy milk or as an accompaniment with congee, soup, or by itself.

Youtube Ajwain Ka Halva.ingredients: ajwain ka halwa, ajwain ka halwa kaise banta hai, ajwain ka halwa kaise banate hain, ajwain ka halwa kaise banaya jata hai
Youtube Ajwain Ka Halva.description:
भयंकर हाथ एड़ी और घुटने कमर के दर्द को जड़ से खत्म अजवायन हलवा

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=3PQN4Jmr4x0

ajwain ka halwa, ajwain ka halwa kaise banta hai, ajwain ka halwa kaise banate hain, ajwain ka halwa kaise banaya jata hai, ajwain ka halwa in hindi, ajwain halwa,

ajwain ka halwa kaise banaen, ajwain halwa recipe

Yo-Yo.description: Yo-Yo is a traditional Venezuelan sandwich made of two fried plantain slices having cheese as a filling in between.

Yuca Al Moho.ingredients: yuca, green onions, garlic, lemon juice, olive oil, butter
Yuca Al Moho.description: Yuca Al Moho is a very popular side dish, very savoury with tons of citrus. Great for breakfast or dinner. A different take on yuca, which is usually eaten fried, in soup, boiled or sautéed in butter.

Yuca Con Chicharron.description: boiled cassava served with fried pork chunks

Yuca Con Mojo.ingredients: yuca, cassava, onions, garlic, lime juice
Yuca Con Mojo.description:
This yuca with Garlic Sauce is a staple of the Cuban cuisine.
Made by marinading yuca root (also known as cassava) in garlic, lime, and olive oil. Often, onions are included in the marinade. Also known as one of Cuba's national dishes.

Yuca Encebollada.ingredients: yucca, white onion, white vinegar, olive oil, salt, sugar
Yuca Encebollada.description: Yuca Encebollada is a simple yet hearty side dish that’s rich in starch and sugars. It’s usually eaten boiled, fried or mashed.

Yuca Fries.description: Yuca Fries are slices of cassava that have been deep-fried in oil similar to french fries and it is served as a side dish in Latin American countries and the Caribbean.

Yuengling Flight beer.description:
Yuengling Flight is a "Lager - Light" style beer with 4.2% alcohol by volume (ABV) and 7 IBU, brewed by Yuengling Brewery Pennsylvania, United States.

12 oz: 95 calories | 2.6 g carbs

Yuengling Light Lager Beer.description:
Yuengling is a "Lager - Light" style beer with 3.8% alcohol by volume (ABV) and 10 IBU, brewed by Yuengling Brewery Pennsylvania, United States.

12 oz: 99 calories | 3.2 g carbs

Yuengling Traditional Lager Beer.description:
Yuengling is an "American Amber" or "Red Lager" style beer with 4.50% alcohol by volume (ABV) and 16 IBU, brewed by Yuengling Brewery Pennsylvania, United States.

12 oz contains 140 calories

Yukgaejang.ingredients: beef brisket, celery, fernbrake, garlic, green onion, ground black pepper, hot pepper flakes, onions, salt, sesame oil, soy sauce, soybean sprouts, vegetable oil, water
Yukgaejang.description:
This soup is smoky, spicy, and rich, with healthy hunks of sliced beef and plenty of vegetables that are soft, but not mushy—they’re full of earthy mountain flavor from gosari (fernbrake). Served with rice, it’s a satisfying, warming meal. When Koreans make yukagejang, they always make it in large batches to make it worth the effort. Extra yukagaejang is full of good stuff and never goes to waste.


https://www.maangchi.com/recipe/yukgaejang

Yukimi Daifuku.ingredients: ice milk, mochi, vanilla, strawberry, red bean paste, green tea, chocolate.
Yukimi Daifuku.description: Yukimi Daifuku is a brand of mochi ice cream manufactured by Lotte. It consists of a ball of vanilla ice milk wrapped in a thin layer of mochi, or rice cake then bathed in coconut milk. It is similar to a Daifuku Japanese dessert where rice cake with the mashed bean inside it. Yukimi Daifuku is one that instead of bean in the center, has ice cream.

Yule Log.description:
Traditional dessert served near Christmas, especially in Belgium, France, Switzerland, Quebec and several former French colonies. Made of sponge cake to resemble a miniature actual Yule log, it is a form of sweet roulade.

The original "Yule log" recipe emerged during the 19th century.] It is traditionally made from a genoise, generally baked in a large, shallow Swiss roll pan, iced, rolled to form a cylinder, and iced again on the outside. The most common combination is basic yellow sponge cake and chocolate buttercream, though many variations which include chocolate cake, ganache, and icings flavored with espresso or liqueurs exist.

"Yule logs" are often served with one end cut off and set atop the cake, or protruding from its side to resemble a chopped off branch. A bark-like texture is often produced by dragging a fork through the icing, and powdered sugar sprinkled to resemble snow. Other cake decorations may include actual tree branches, fresh berries, and mushrooms made of meringue or marzipan.

Yum Mama.description: Yum Mama is a salad type dish made of Mama (Instant Noodle). Is a spicy mix of fresh ingredients with strong and pungent flavor. It's is very easy and quick to make.

Yum Moo Yang.description: Marinated salad with pork belly & red onions.

Yum Sen Lon.description: It  is a Laotian salad. It is served with watercress, lettuce, tomato, boiled egg, with mayonnaise and peanuts.

Yuquitas Rellenas.ingredients: yuca root, queso fresco, eggs, bread, saltine crackers, vegetable oil, salt, pepper, huancaína sauce
Yuquitas Rellenas.description: Yuquitas Rellenas is a traditional dish from Peruvian. Yuquitas is a root vegetable, also known as cassava and manioc root. It can be peeled and boiled just like potatoes, and it's a staple food in many parts of Peru.

Yuvarlakia.description: It a Greek meatball (kefte κεφτέ) made of beef and rice or bulgur and cooked in moist heat; it is also a dish of these meatballs in tomato or avgolemono sauce.

Yuxiang Qiezi.description: Strips of eggplant fried and doused in Sichuan’s sweet-sour-spicy sauce. Literally translated, it means “fish-fragrance eggplant,” but there is no fish involved in physical or aromatic presence; the term comes in reference to the sauce, which is also used to prepare fish.

Yuzu Sorbet.description:
Yuzu is commonly used in Japanese cuisine when it’s in season in fall or winter. It’s wonderful to make Yuzu Sorbet to round up the Japanese New Year dishes for a bright future. It also helps to refresh the palate for the delicious foods we enjoy during the holiday.




http://www.justonecookbook.com/osechi-ryori-japanese-new-year-food/

Zaalouk.ingredients: aubergine, eggplants, tomatoes, garlic, olive oil
Zaalouk.description: Zaalouk is a one of the most basic and traditional Moroccan salads. It is made of cooked aubergine (eggplant) and other fresh ingredients like tomatoes, garlic, olive oil and spices. It is served as a side dish to many meals and used as a dip with crusty bread.

Zabaione.description: It is an Italian dessert, or sometimes a beverage, made with egg yolks, sugar, and a sweet wine (usually Moscato d'Asti or Marsala wine).Some versions of the recipe incorporate spirits such as cognac. The dessert version is a light custard, whipped to incorporate a large amount of air.

Zacirka.ingredients: flour, eggs, milk, sugar, butter, salt
Zacirka.description: Zacirka is a traditional snacks of Belarusian prepared by blending flour and a little salt into beaten eggs to form a thick mixture.

Zacusc\u0103.description: Zacusca is a vegetable spread popular in Romania. The main ingredients are roasted eggplant, sauteed onions, tomato paste, and roasted red peppers.

Zagorski \u0160trukli.description: Zagorski Strukli is a popular traditional Croatian dish served in households across Hrvatsko Zagorje and Zagreb regions in the north of the country, composed of dough and various types of filling which can be either cooked or baked. Zagorski Strukli is a mixture of cottage cheese with eggs, sour cream and salt are spread thinly over the pastry. Then the pastry is rolled lengthwise from both sides into two joined rolls and finally cut into 10–20 cm long pieces.

Zagreba\u010dki Odrezak.ingredients: meat, ham, cheese, flour, bread crumbs, spices
Zagreba\u010dki Odrezak.description: Zagrebački odrezak is a Croatian meat dish consisting of veal cutlets that are pounded, filled with cheese and ham, rolled, breaded, then fried until golden and crispy. Nowadays, the dish has many variations and some cooks prepare it with pork, chicken, or turkey. It is important that the cheese melts well, and the ham should have minimal fat. Once prepared, this succulent meat dish is typically accompanied by lemon wedges, rice and peas, potatoes, and green salads.

Zakuski.ingredients: cold cuts, cured fishes, pickled vegetables, hard cheeses, caviar, breads
Zakuski.description: Consist of cold cuts, cured fishes, mixed salads, kholodets (meat jelly), pirogs or pirozhki, various pickled vegetables such as tomatoes, beets, cucumbers, sauerkraut, pickled mushrooms, deviled eggs, hard cheeses, caviar, canapés, open sandwiches, and breads. Iced vodka or other alcoholic beverages is often served with the appetizers. https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Zakuski

Zanzibar Mix.ingredients: potatoes, chickpeas, peanuts fried onions, light curry sauce  chutney .
Zanzibar Mix.description: This dish has become famous in the Island of Zanzibar off mainland Tanzania .  It is a creamy curry soup blending Indian and African flavours . A mix of potatoes chickpeas,fried bhajias and peanuts are placed in a bowl a the bottom . This is then covered with a creamy curry sauce .Finally topped with coconut chutney and often sweet potato (cassava) chips.

Zanzibar Pizza.ingredients: flour, salt, onions, tomatoes, cream cheese cube, minced meat, eggs
Zanzibar Pizza.description: Zanzibar Pizza is a Tanzanian Dish. The main ingredients are flour, salt, onion, tomato, Cream cheese cube, Minced meat, egg,  The dough is stretched thin and filled with the fillings. It is pan-fried and served hot.

Zapiekanka.description: It is an open-face sandwich made of half of a baguette or other long roll of bread, topped with sautéed white mushrooms, cheese and sometimes other ingredients, and toasted until the cheese melts. Served hot with ketchup,

Zaru Soba.ingredients: dried soba noodles, dashi stock, soy sauce, nori, sugar, mirin
Zaru Soba.description:
Cold buckwheat (soba) noodles are a favorite Japanese summer dish, cool and refreshing. Traditionally served on a bamboo tray, or zaru, zaru soba are dipped in seasoned soy sauce before they are ceremoniously slurped down.




http://www.justonecookbook.com/zaru-soba-cold-soba-noodles/

Zarzuela De Mariscos.ingredients: almonds, pork, peppers, tomatoes, mussels, clams, shrimps, scallops, saffron, wine, spices
Zarzuela De Mariscos.description: Zarzuela de mariscos is a traditional Catalan seafood stew. Although the dish is similar to Marseille's bouillabaise, it's more rustic because it contains ground almonds, and the flavours are bolder due to ingredients such as cured pork, peppers, and tomatoes. The ingredients are mussels, clams, and shrimp, but some people like to add scallops and calamari as well. Other ingredients include saffron, white wine, olive oil, bay leaves, onions, garlic, rosemary, and thyme, with smoked paprika and parsley used as garnishes.

Zefir.description: This is Russian traditional dessert.It is a type of soft confectionery made by whipping fruit and apple puree with sugar and egg whites with subsequent addition of a gelling agent like pectin, carrageenan, agar, or gelatin.

Zemiakov\u00e9 Placky.description: Zemiakové Placky can be translated to “potato pancakes” and is a staple food of the traditional Slovak diet. These are often given to schoolchildren as an after-school snack, but they are also served as a side dish or an accompaniment to soup. The best potato pancakes are fried in good quality oil and are crunchy on the outside but gooey on the inside. They should be eaten warm with sour cream, kefir or soured milk.

Zenzai.ingredients: red bean paste, water, salt, rice cake
Zenzai.description:
Zenzai is a thick sweet dessert soup made of azuki red beans and often served with mochi (toasted rice cake). Although is not considered part of osechi ryori, this delicious dessert soup is a comforting treat for Japanese people especially during the winter time.



http://www.justonecookbook.com/osechi-ryori-japanese-new-year-food/

Zeppole.description:
It is an Italian pastry consisting of a deep-fried dough ball of varying size but typically about 4 inches (10 cm) in diameter. This doughnut or fritter is usually topped with powdered sugar, and may be filled with custard, jelly, cannoli-style pastry cream, or a butter-and-honey mixture. 

https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Zeppole

Zerbian.description:
Zerbian is a lamb dish made distinctly with the most expensive spice in the world, saffron.  The rice, lamb, and spices are all cooked simultaneously in the pot together, unlike mandi, where the rice and meat is cooked separately.  It is usually served at special occasions, such as weddings. 

http://yemenfood.blogspot.com/p/food.html

Zerde.description: Zerde is a Turkish dessert, a sort of sweet pudding from rice that is colored yellow with saffron. It is a festive dish popular at weddings, birth celebrations, and during the first ten days of the sacred month of Muharram. Zerd comes from Persian language zard which means yellow.

Zhajiangmian.description:
Zhajiangmian, also noodles in soybean paste, is a Chinese dish consisting of thick wheat noodles topped with zhajiang sauce. Zhajiang sauce is normally made by simmering stir-fried ground pork or beef with salty fermented soybean paste.

 zhajiang (fermented soybean paste)

https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Zhajiangmian

Zhaliang.description: It  is a Cantonese dim sum. It is made by tightly wrapping rice noodle roll around youtiao (fried dough). It is usually eaten with soy milk or congee and served with sauce and sesame seeds or paste.

Zharkoye.description: This is a wonderful ancient Russian dish.A stew made from beef, potatoes, carrots, parsley, and celery, lightly spiced with garlic, cloves, and dill. Served hot with sour cream.

Zhele.description: Zhele is a gelatin Jell-O-like dessert composed of fruit juice and sugar. Fruits used in zhele include cherries and pears, though jellied chocolate and milk are sometimes added too. Zhele is a Traditional Ukraine dessert.

Zhoug.ingredients: hot pepper, garlic, coriander, garlic, cardamom, salt
Zhoug.description: Zhoug is a traditional Middle Eastern sauce and condiment that originated from Yemen, but it's also very popular in Israel. The sauce is usually made from green or red hot peppers, garlic, coriander, cumin, cardamom, salt, and various spices.

Zigini.description: Zigini is a spicy stew prepared with berbere spices and beef or lamb cubes. The stew is usually served with a flatbread called Injera. It is one of the traditional stew of Eritrea.

Zigini With Injera.ingredients: spices, beef or lamb, oil, onions, garlic, tomatoes, cilantro
Zigini With Injera.description: Zigini with injera is a traditional Eritrean dish consisting of two elements – zigini, a spicy stew prepared with berbere spices and beef or lamb cubes, and injera, a flatbread cooked on a griddle or a stone. In order to prepare zigini, cooks use ingredients such as cubed meat, oil, onions, garlic, canned tomatoes, berbere spices, and cilantro for garnish. Once prepared, the stew is served over the flatbread, but injera can also be used as a utensil for consuming this spicy stew.

Zilzil Tibs.ingredients: meat, butter, ginger, turmeric, onions, pepper
Zilzil Tibs.description: Zilzil tibs is an Ethiopian dish kind of a hybrid between a stir fry and a stew. Strips of tender beef sauteed in butter, herbs, spices and vegetables. It is meaty, rich and can be very spicy, traditionally served family-style on a bed of Injera.

\u017din\u010dica.description: Žinčica is a drink made of sheep milk whey similar to kefir consumed mostly in Slovakia. It is a by-product in the process of making bryndza cheese.

Zippuli.description: It is fried dough from Calabria, Italy. In Calabrian cuisine, zippuli are made with fried potatoes and sometimes anchovies.

Zivania Brandy.description: Zivania Brandy is  Cypriot brandy with  45% alcohol. It is produced from grape pomace—solid components of grapes that are left after the juice has been pressed. The distillate is then mixed with dry wines which are traditionally produced from native Mavro and Xynisteri grapes. It is usually enjoyed as an aperitif, but it is also commonly paired with nuts or meze—a selection of small dishes.

Zlevanka.ingredients: eggs, sugar, salt, corn flour, milk, fresh cheese or sour cream, yeast, oil
Zlevanka.description: Zlevanka is a traditional peasant pie-like dish that is especially popular in the central and northern parts of Croatia. It consists of eggs, sugar, salt, corn flour, milk, fresh cheese or sour cream, yeast, and oil. The pie is sometimes enriched with the addition of grated apples or poppy seeds.

Zmeurat\u0103.description: Zmeurata is a Romanian alcoholic beverage produced from Raspberry (zmeură in Romanian), sugar and alcohol.

Zobo.ingredients: dried hibiscus leaves, ginger, pineapple bark, water, sugar
Zobo.description: Zobo drink is a familiar beverage loved by Nigerians. It is produced from dried Hibiscus leaves. This bright red drink is loved both for every day and as a refreshment drink in parties. This drink has many advantages: available, affordable, tasty, refreshing and have a lot healthy benefit

Zombie Cocktail.description: Zombie Cocktail is a cocktail made of fruit juices, liqueurs, and various rums.

Zombie Dust Beer.description: Zombie Dust is a Pale Ale - American style beer with 6.2% Alcohol by volume (ABV) and 60 IBU. Brewed by 3 Floyds Brewing Co. Indiana, United States.

Zongzi.description: Zongzi is a traditional Chinese food, made of glutinous rice stuffed with different fillings and wrapped in bamboo, reed, or other large flat leaves.

Z\u014dni.description: It is similar to korean Tteokguk dish. It  is a Japanese soup containing mochi rice cakes.The dish is strongly associated with the Japanese New Year and its tradition of osechi ceremonial foods.

Zopf.description: Zopf is a type of Swiss, Austrian or Bavarian bread made from white flour, milk, eggs, butter and yeast. The dough is brushed with egg yolk before baking, lending it its golden crust. It is baked in the form of a plait and traditionally eaten on Sunday mornings.

Zosui.ingredients: rice, soy sauce, meat, seafods, vegetables, mushrooms
Zosui.description:
Zosui is a mild and thin Japanese rice soup akin to a vegetable soup with lots of rice. It is made from pre-cooked rice and water seasoned with either soy sauce or miso and cooked with other ingredients such as meat, seafood, mushrooms, and vegetables. It is generally served to those who are sick or otherwise feeling unwell, and is usually only served in the winter.



https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Zosui

Zrazy.description: It is traditional Ukrainian dish. Beef cutlets with different fillings. The filling can be different: meat, cabbage or mushrooms. Ukrainian zrazy are stuffed potato.

Zucchini Stuffed Zucchini Blossoms.ingredients: diced zucchini, white onion, olive oil, soft goat cheese, salt, smoked paprika, eggs, flour.
Zucchini Stuffed Zucchini Blossoms.description: It is made with squash blossoms edible flowers of Cucurbita species, particularly Cucurbita pepo, the species that produces zucchini, marrow, spaghetti squash, and many other types of squash. In Great Britain they are called courgette flower.It is very tasty snacks food with diced zucchini, egg, flour, white onion, olive oil, soft goat cheese, salt, smoked paprika for evening time.

Zuppa Inglese.description: It is an Italian dessert layering custard and sponge cake, perhaps derived from trifle. To make Zuppa Inglese, sponge cake or ladyfingers are dipped in Alchermes, a bright red, extremely aromatic Italian herb liqueur. They are then alternated with layers of crema pasticciera, a thick egg custard cooked with a large piece of lemon zest.

Z\u00fcrcher Geschnetzeltes.ingredients: flour, veal, mushrooms, white wine, cream, butter, calf's kidney, cognac, parsley
Z\u00fcrcher Geschnetzeltes.description:
Swiss dish from the Zurich region. The veal and kidney are cut into small thin strips.


https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Z%C3%BCrcher_Geschnetzeltes

Zwetschgenkuchen.description: It is popular as a summer cake and has different local labelings throughout Germany, Austria and Switzerland made with yeast dough or shortcrust, prune plums.

Zwieback.description: Zwieback is a form of rusk eaten in Germany, Scandinavia, Austria, France, Belgium, The Netherlands, Switzerland, Italy, Slovenia, Bosnia, Croatia, Serbia, North Macedonia, Bulgaria, Greece and Turkey. It is a type of crisp, sweetened bread, made with eggs and baked twice.

Zwiebelkuchen.description: This is a savory German one-crust onion cake made of steamed onions, diced bacon, cream, and caraway seeds on either a yeast dough or a leavened dough. https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Zwiebelkuchen
